e4: Switching to the new policy promotes accuracy and transparency, reinforcing trust with investors and adhering to regulatory standards. While some short-term impact on stock price and retail investor uncertainties may occur, in the long run, this aligns with ethical norms and builds a foundation for sustainable investment confidence.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should prioritize transparency, accuracy, and plain honesty, offering stakeholders a clear understanding of financial conditions. It ought to adhere strictly to legal regulations and evade triggering any marketplace misapprehensions. Accountability and consistency in reporting bids trust from investors; these drive informed financial decision-making while safeguarding receipts atop reputation mindscape.
e6: What plans do we have to effectively communicate the change to the new policy and mitigate any immediate negative impacts on stock pricing or investor relationships? Additionally, what strategic considerations have we included to support or address retail investor awareness in alignment with these reporting transformations?
